meanings.definition: To sow seeds beneath a crop already growing.
meanings.sent1: Farmers undersow to ensure a plentiful harvest.
meanings.sent2: It is important to undersow at the right time for the best results.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to undersow acorns in the garden.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness seemed to undersow hope in the hearts of those around her.
meanings.sent5: The magician's words seemed to undersow magic in the air.

meanings.definition: The act of sowing seeds beneath a crop.
meanings.sent1: The undersow of seeds helped the plants grow stronger.
meanings.sent2: A successful harvest often depends on the quality of the undersow.
meanings.sent3: The undersow of wildflowers created a beautiful surprise in the field.
meanings.sent4: His smile was like a gentle undersow of happiness in the room.
meanings.sent5: The undersow of kindness in her actions left a lasting impact on others.
